frameDefinitions: The answer to one open question, the Outcome, is dictated (partially or completely) by the answer to another open question, the Determinant, i.e. if the answer to the Determinant is known, the answer to the Outcome can be predicted.
A Protagonist is sensitive to a Trigger, which has the potential to cause some kind of reaction in the Protagonist.  '' 'Mr. Clinton and his wife Hillary are allergic to cats.'
A Protagonist needs a Means action performed for their Benefit.
A Protagonist is described as being exposed to a potentially dangerous situation that may end in a Bad_outcome for him- or herself.
In this frame, a Communicator judges the Addressee and then communicates that appraisal directly to the Addressee.
A Protagonist delays a planned action because they cannot or do not want to proceed until an Expected_event occurs.
frameExamples: Economic policy is partially a <t>function</t> of cultural values.
Mr. Clinton and his wife Hillary are <t>allergic</t> to cats.
(1) I <t>rely</t> on you to see that my name is not sullied.
The principal <t>rebuked</t> the student for cheating on the exam.
The cat <t>waited</t> on top of the washer as Elmer popped the lid off the can of cat food and then pounded the can's contents onto the plate
listRoleDefinitions: An open question that is (to some degree) predictable from the Determinant.
An open question that determines the <fen>Outcome</fen>.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen> occurs as the External Argument of the targets in this frame. The <fen>Protagonist</fen> represents the one exhibiting the response to the <fen>Trigger</fen>.

The <fen>Trigger</fen> most commonly occurs in a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment>. The <fen>Trigger</fen> is that substance or element which causes a health response in the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
The person or thing whose needs are served by the <fen>Means</fen> action.
An action or state that the <fen>Means</fen> action brings about and from which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> profits.
The person or thing that performs a <fen>Means</fen> action to the <fen>Benefit</fen> of the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
An object that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> uses to realize a <fen>Benefit</fen>.
An action or state that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> wants to bring about.  It is more or less the <fen>Benefit</fen> viewed in relation to the <fen>Protagonist</fen> rather than the <fen>Means</fen>.
An action performed either by the <fen>Protagonist</fen> or an <fen>Intermediary</fen> that has a <fen>Benefit</fen> for  the <fen>Protagonist</fen> attached to it.
The person who is at risk of some <fen>Bad_outcome</fen>
A situation that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> would like to avoid.
Something desirable possessed by or directly associated with the <fen>Protagonist</fen> which might be lost or damaged.
The <fen>Action</fen> that creates the risk.
The time when the risk pertains.
The place where there is risk.
The <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates a judgment to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> is jduged by the <fen>Communicator</fen> and receives the message of approval or disapproval.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject on which the <fen>Addressee</fen> is being judged.
The <fen>Reason</fen> is why the Communicator forms the type of judgment they form.
The <fen>Medium</fen> identifies the physical or abstract entity in which the judgment is conveyed.
An action or entity under the control of the <fen>Communicator</fen> that expresses the criticism or praise directed towards the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The point in time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> berates or compliments the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> admonishes the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The sentient being who cannot proceed with their planned activities until a Salient_entity has arrived or an Expected_event has occurred.
A concrete or abstract entity that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> expects to participate in an <fen>Expected_event</fen>, typically that of arriving at the <fen>Place</fen> of the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
The <fen>Expected_event</fen> is an event that needs to take place or a state that needs to begin to hold before the <fen>Protagonist</fen> can proceed with their planned activities.
The time period during which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is waiting.
The location in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is waiting.
listRoleExamples: Price, in such a case, depends <fex>only on the whim of the supplier</fex>.
<fex>Pat's</fex> allergy to dairy products is severe.
Some people are very sensitive <fex>to chemicals in the environment</fex>.
<fex>I</fex> rely on this walking stick to get me around
He still relies on me <fex>to do the head work</fex>
We rely <fex>on you</fex> for feedback and input
I hate having to rely <fex>on my car</fex> to get where I want to go
The user will quickly begin to rely on the pills <fex>to cope with life pressures</fex>.
We rely <fex>on your response</fex>
There was no risk <fex>of his returning</fex>.
The risk <fex>to his reputation</fex> was significant.
<fex>Implementing this program</fex> runs the risk of offending our core constituents.
<fex>Even after the end of Apartheit</fex> we still run the risk of letting racism continue forever.
There is always some danger to rich men <fex>in a bar like this</fex>.
The teacher scolded the children <fex>about their meessy cookie eating</fex>.
The principal rebuked the student <fex>for cheating on the exam</fex>.
Though she had killed him so long ago, she could still see his jeering <fex>smile</fex>.
She complimented me <fex>almost every morning</fex> on my smart starched shirts.
We were scolded <fex>in the kitchen</fex> by the biggest cook you've ever seen.
<fex>He</fex> politely waited, hat in hand, until he could speak.
In busier times several passengers are waiting <fex>for the train</fex>.
She did n't wait <fex>for a reply</fex>, but spelled out the answer herself.
At least 17 ships were waiting <fex>yesterday</fex> to come up the river.
Reporters are waiting <fex>outside the State Guesthouse</fex> for the talks to start .

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Senate Committee on Foreign Relations
the Center for Strategic and International Studies
